label: Description
value: Galatea, riding a pair of dolphins and accompanied by sea gods, emerges from the water. Neptune is beside her upon the waves as she sprays milk from her breast.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, traces of black chalk on white laid paper; framing lines in black chalk

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Notes
value: Galatea, riding a pair of dolphins and accompanied by sea gods, emerges from the water. Neptune is beside her upon the waves as she sprays milk from her breast.

label: Description
value: Small figures on a pass in a narrow valley.  A steep cliff face framing at left. Atmospheric perspective.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value:
Top: Telemachus and his companion Minerva disguised as Mentor invited by Calypso into her lodging.  She is shown from the right back walking, in the center.  An altar is in the right forground.  The servants prepare the meal in the right distance.  Caption:
"1 Mentore Talemaco alogiati/dalla Dea Calipso."  
In the right margin is a pen sketch for a slightly altered pose of Calypso.  Bottom Calypso seated at dinner with her guests give orders to a group of singers and a lyre player standing at left to cheer up the guests.  Telemachus leans his head in his right hand. Servants bring plates in the rear.  Caption:
"Convito fatto da Calipso/ a talemaco."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink,brush and wash, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value:
Top: Telemachus seated beside Calypso upon a bench tells her about his travels.  The setting shows a rocky valley; Mentor leans against slope at the left.  Caption to the right: 
"3 Talemaco raonta li suoi/ viaggi a Calipso dea."  [3 Telemachus tells his / trip to the goddess Calypso]

In the left margin: sketch: enthroned Calypso listens to Telemachus, standing with Mentor before her at left.  Written in right margin:
 "Felice/chi/termina la sua/ vita in eta/ vechia come / fece Timoleone/ ad corinto". 

Bottom: a bearded priest of Apollo, who is seated upon a stone step having beside him a lyre and a roll of paper, gives a book to Telemachus, who stands at left.  A part of the temple is shown.  Caption:

 "4 Talemaco riceve un libro dall/ sacerdote di Apollo" [4 Talemaco receives a book from / priest of Apollo]

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on cream laid paper

Telemachus and the sheperds sacrifice in the temple of Apollo

label: Description
value:
A priest standing at the altar implores the god.  A bull lies beside the altar, killed by a kneeling man.  Telemachus and the sheperds, kneeling or standing surroung the altar.  A part of the temple front is shown in the rear.  
Caption: "6 sacrifici fatti da Talemaco/ a dolli pastori al tempio di/ Apollo."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
Four Drawings of the Myth of Apollo; Decoration of a Wall over a Mantel, Sala di Apollo, Palazzo Cavina, Faenza

label: Description
value: Apollo pursues fleeing Daphne, running toward left where her father, River-god Peneus, lies at foot of rock. Inscribed with graphite above: Apollo Dafne. Center: Apollo supports wounded Hyacinthus, surrounded by landscape. Inscribed in graphite: Apollo e Giacinto. Bottom left: Apollo runs towards dead Python, bow in hand. Setting shows narrow valley with temple of Delphi in rear. Inscribed in graphite: Apollo serpent/ pitone. Bottom right: Apollo as shepherd of King Admetus, seated before rock, blows flute. Mercurius listens from behind rock. Inscribed in graphite: Apollo pastore del re/ admeto. Verso: upper part of mantel shown. Wall panel suggested over mantel, square panels and contained in center, oval painting of standing genius or Apollo, possibly holding lyre. Entablature of room above.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and greyish-brown wash over traces of graphite on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
Juno Suckling Hercules, Hebe Marries Hercules with Help of Minerva, Designed for Sala di Ercole e Ebe, Palazzo Gaddi, Forli.

label: Description
value: At left, Juno seated in domed hall. She gives right breast to child seated upon her right leg. Minerva stands beside and looks on. Caption: "Giuonone allatta Erocle/ Minerva ne gode." At right: Minerva having put her left arm around Hercules, leads him to Hebe, whose right arm she takes. Hebe has joined hands with Hercules. Cupid led her to Hercules. A table with pitcher shown left rear, Hercules club leans against the pedestal of column in right rear. Caption: "Ebe sposa di Ercole con l'asistenza di Minerva."

label: Physical description

Orpheus, Ceres, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza

label: Description
value: Orpheus seated beneath trees, plays lyre while quadrupeds and birds listen. Inscribed in ink: orfeo inv della musica.   At right, Ceres show in profile, kneeling and turned toward right, cutting grain with sickle. Temple and trees in rear. Inscribed below: cerere inv delle biade. Lower parts of letters and figures at upper edge.

Pales, Triptolemus, Decoration for a Vault, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi

label: Description
value: Pales holding shepherd staff shown in profile, seated beneath tree.  Flock of goats and sheep presses around well.  Inscription, Pale inv de pascoli. At right, Triptolemus holds reins of two snakes drawing plow chariot, inscribed Tritolamo inve del aratro.

Bacchus, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza

label: Description
value: Bacchus shown in profile, turned toward right and seated.  He pours wine from pitcher into bowl. Vine, at right. Thyrsus and crouching panther in left foreground. Inscribed, Bacco inv delle vigne. And inscribed at top left, 9V.

Vulcan, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza

label: Description
value: Vulcan shown in profile, seated beside anvil toward left, inside cave. Right hand holds group of Three Graces, left hand holds hammer. Distant view of volcano. Inscribed inside oval: Volcano invent delle arti. Top left, perhaps part of "7."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash over black chalk on rolled paper

label: Credit line

Minerva, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza

label: Description
value: Minerva stands beneath trees having left foot upon base of pedestal, upon which pitcher rests. She holds snake which drinks from bowl held in her left hand. Inscription: minerva pacifica.  At right, Themis seated upon thrown, decorated with fasces.  She holds pair of scales and sword. Opened book leans against wall of domed circular hall, at left. Inscription: temi giostisia.

Man the Hunter, Man the Shepherd, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza

label: Description
value: Young man in pose of Apollo, standing over carcass, points bow toward stag running in right distance. Inscription: L'omo cacciatore.  At right, shepherd, wearing Phrygian cap, blows pan flute. Cattle at right. Inscription: L'omo pastore.

Man the Farmer, Diana the Goddess of the Hunt, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza

label: Description
value: Bearded man plows with two bulls, in mountainous landscape. Inscription, L'omo agricoltore, Diana inv della caccia.  At right, Diana shown in profile, seated at edge of brook, binding her left sandal, in wooded landscape. Dog drinks from brook, in right foreground. Inscribed on the verso: Non avendo risposta a una mia  di novo vi scrivo pregandovi di far ricerca nel tavolino del gabinetto di Giusti.

value: Pen and ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on laid paper

label: Description
